1.title: Let's Race!
1.plot: Mum and Melody are making lunch. Melody is in a hurry to eat hers because she wants to listen to some music but spills her drink down her dinosaur top. Mum says sometimes it's best to do things slowly and finds some music for Melody to listen to. She has chosen Dance of the Knights from Romeo and Juliet composed by Prokofiev. Melody imagines two dinosaurs having a race. Initially the smaller dinosaur is winning, but stops to take a rest. The larger dinosaur plods on slowly but surely and wins the race. Melody's verdict is that slow is best.

2.title: Muddy Melody
2.plot: Melody is playing in the garden with the garden sprinkler but her feet get cold and muddy. Mum suggests a game of elephants instead. When they go inside mum suggests a piece of music that makes her think a muddy elephant. She has chosen Fanfare for the Common Man composed by Aaron Copland. Melody imagines she is a jungle explorer who has found a baby elephant playing in the mud. Other animals join the elephant and they get splashed with mud but they soon disappear. The baby elephant is disappointed to finds himself alone but then Melody the jungle explorer finds his ...

3.title: Red Riding Hood
3.plot: Melody has the dressing box out and is putting on different masks, because wearing masks makes you feel like someone else. Mum joins in the game. Melody asks mum if she has any music that makes her think of dressing up. Mum has chosen some dramatic music, which makes her think of a really big adventure. She has chosen Danse Macabre, composed by Camille Saint-Saens. Melody imagines the story of Little Red Riding Hood. At the end of the animation Melody is not sure how she knows it's mummy and not the big bad wolf, but mum reassures her.

4.title: Fast Little Train
4.plot: Mum and Melody are going on a train journey. As they wait for the train, Mum gives Melody some train music to listen to. She has chosen Symphony No 1 in D Major composed by Prokofiev. Melody imagines a story about a little train who wants to make his journey go faster and gives his passengers a bumpy ride. Melody hopes their journey is a bit slower, so they can have time to enjoy it.

5.title: Promises
5.plot: Melody wants to go to the park but Mum makes her promise to make her bed. Melody gets sidetracked with dressing Fudge as a princess. Mum is ready to go to the park but she doesn't realize Melody hasn't kept her promise to make her bed. Melody thinks she will do it when she gets back. While in the park Melody is feeling sad that she didn't keep her promise. Mum, not realizing the reason for Melody being sad, finds some music to cheer her up. She chooses Fantasia on a Theme by Thomas Tallis, composed by Ralph Vaughan Williams. Melody imagines a princess in a castle who ...

6.title: The Lost Bee
6.plot: Melody, Mum and Fudge are going on a picnic. On the way to the picnic, Melody can identify where she is by the various noises she hears - fountains, a car, rustling trees. They have their picnic in the park but can hear a bee buzzing around them. Melody asks mum for some bee music. Mum has Flight of the Bumblebee composed by Rimsky-Korsakov on her MP3 player, which takes Melody on a bee adventure. Melody helps a lost bee find its way home by reminding it to remember all the things it saw on its way, when it left home. On Melody's way home she remembers all the things ...

7.title: Melody and the Snowman
7.plot: Melody wants Mum to play with her but she is too busy. Melody is cross and stomps off outside, but it is very cold. Mum soon joins her and Melody asks for music that makes her think of cold things. Mum has just the thing - the Sugar Plum Fairy composed by Tchaikovsky, which makes Melody think about a story of a lonely snowman and a little girl. At the end of the music Melody has cheered up and Mum and Melody make a cake together.

8.title: Best Friends
8.plot: Mum collects Melody from school but they realize on the way home that Fudge is missing. They ask various people if they have seen him. On their way to find Fudge, they stop and Mum gets out her mp3 player with some music to make Melody feel better. She plays Jupiter composed by Gustav Holst. Melody imagines the story of best friends, an elephant and a dog, who are separated when the elephant goes to live in the royal kingdom. The elephant becomes unhappy without his friend, so the king sends for the little dog. They are soon reunited. Mum and Melody continue their ...

9.title: Elves and the Shoemaker
9.plot: Melody wants to make something for Fudge but she needs some help. Mum starts to make something with her sewing machine and the tapping of the sewing machine inspires Melody to ask for tapping music. Mum finds Short Ride In a Fast Machine composed by John Adams. Melody is transported into the world of the elves and the shoemaker, where an elf finds out the magic of the words 'thank you'.

10.title: Butterfly Ball
10.plot: Melody and Mum are making a butterfly. Melody flies the butterfly in her garden and then asks Mum if she knows where real butterflies go when they dance away from the garden. Mum doesn't know but says she has some music that makes her think about butterflies - Minuet, composed by Luigi Boccherini. Melody imagines that she and Fudge are playing chase through lots of flowers. Butterflies appear and dance around like a butterfly ball, then other animals join in the dancing. Afterward, Mum shows Melody a butterfly mobile, she has hung in the garden.

11.title: Ugly Duckling
11.plot: Melody and mum are at the kitchen table sculpting things out of modelling clay. Melody makes a bird but it doesn't turn out quite how she wanted. Mum has just the music for Melody to listen to, which is The Lake In The Moonlight from Swan Lake composed by Tchaikovsky. When Melody listens to the music she is taken into the world of the ugly duckling. After the music ends Melody reveals she has made a beautiful swan.

12.title: Coat of Leaves
12.plot: Melody is getting ready to go out to play. She wants to wear her summer coat but mum explains the seasons have changed and she needs her warmer winter coat. Melody asks mum for music about different seasons. Mum chooses Four Seasons - Autumn composed by Vivaldi, which goes into an animation, where Melody imagines the seasons changing. After the animation finishes, Melody realizes she shouldn't be sad at not being able to where her summer coat because she will be able to wear it again when the weather gets warmer.

13.title: Flying High
13.plot: Melody and mum are in the park. Melody wants to go on all the things in the playground. She hears a bird in the park and asks mum for some bird music. Mum chooses The Lark Ascending composed by Ralph Vaughan Williams. When Melody hears the music she is taken to the animated world of birds flying high.

14.title: Selfish Shellfish
14.plot: Melody is playing in her sandpit and finds a conch shell. She can hear the sea in the shell but she won't let Fudge hear it too. Mum says it's important to share. Melody asks mum for some music that makes her think of the sea. Mum chooses Aquarium from Carnival of Animals composed by Camille Saint-Saens. The animation is about the selfish shellfish and afterwards Melody decides to share her shell with Fudge.

15.title: Tiptoe Troll
15.plot: Melody and Mum are making a crown. Melody wants the crown now but it's not dry yet. She tries to tiptoe past mum to get to the crown drying in the garden. Mum hears her and says she will have to tiptoe more quietly. Melody tiptoes round the garden while she's waiting for the crown to dry. She asks mum for some tiptoeing music. Mum chooses Up the Hill of the Mountain King composed by Greig. In the animation trolls have stolen treasure including the king's crown but Melody and Fudge tiptoe past the sleeping trolls and manage to get the king's crown back. Everyone is ...

16.title: Unlikely Partners
16.plot: Melody and Mum are making an African collage. Melody wants to make a friend for the hippo. Melody wants some music for mice and hippos so mum finds the Elgar Cello Concerto 1st Movement. The music takes Melody into an animation with a dancing hippo and mouse. Melody was going to make an elephant for the collage but ends up wanting to make a mouse.

17.title: A Royal Stink
17.plot: Mum has made a new soup for Melody to try but she doesn't want to. King Fudge is going to try the soup instead as the soup is fit for Royalty. Mum has some royal music for Melody to listen to. She has chosen Music for the Royal Fireworks composed by Handel, which takes Melody into an animation about a Royal stew. Once the animation has finished Melody decides to give the soup a try and likes it.

18.title: When the Cat's Away
18.plot: Melody is getting ready for bed but she is sad as Melody suddenly realizes Fudge is missing. Mum phones grandma and finds out Melody has left it at grandma's house. Mum has some fun music for Melody to listen to. She has chosen the Annen Polka composed by Johann Strauss, which takes Melody into an animation, imagining what Fudge is up to while he's away. Fudge is having a great time playing with all the toys. When Melody stops listening to the music, she tells mum about Fudge having fun. Mum finds Melody a piece of soft material to help her get to sleep. All ends ...

19.title: Boat Ballet
19.plot: Melody and Mum are at the park. Melody watches the sailing boats on the lake and she asks mum if she has any sailing music. Mum chooses Gymnopedie No. 1 composed by Erik Satie. Melody imagines a beautiful boat ballet with dancing swans. After the animation Melody tells mum all about the boat ballet and the dancing swans she's seen.

20.title: The White Whale
20.plot: Melody and Fudge are off to the pet shop to see some fish. Melody loves seeing the fish in the pet shop . Mum thinks whales are the most graceful creatures in the sea so Melody asks mum to choose some music for her whales. Mum chooses Nimrod composed by Edward Elgar, which takes Melody's imagination to see graceful dancing whales. After the animation, Melody finds mum has bought fish and a fish tank to take home.

imdb.title: Melody
plot: Pre-school mixed-media music show. _Melody_ (qv) is a partially-sighted girl with an incredible imagination who visualizes stories and characters conjured up by classical music.::CBeebies
